text: Copying and pasting code into the Python interpreter
There is a snippet of code that I would like to copy and paste into my Python interpreter.
Unfortunately due to Python's sensitivity to whitespace it is not straightforward to copy and paste it a way that makes sense.
(I think the whitespace gets mangled) Is there a better way?
Maybe I can load the snippet from a file.
This is just an small example but if there is a lot of code I would like to avoid typing everything from the definition of the function or copy and pasting line by line.

code:
class bcolors: 
    HEADER = '\033[95m' 
    OKBLUE = '\033[94m' 
    OKGREEN = '\033[92m' 
    WARNING = '\033[93m' 
    FAIL = '\033[91m' 
    ENDC = '\033[0m' 

    def disable(self):  
        self.HEADER = '' # I think stuff gets mangled because of the extra level of indentation 
        self.OKBLUE = '' 
        self.OKGREEN = '' 
        self.WARNING = '' 
        self.FAIL = '' 
        self.ENDC = ''
